snippet: With President Ashraf Ghani antagonizing many with his imperious decisions, some are reconsidering his predecessor, Hamid Karzai, who has not strayed far from the center of power.
abstract: Memo From Afghanistan; Afghans look back at presidency of Hamid Karzai with surprising fondness as Pres Ashraf Ghani makes imperious decisions and struggles to complete functioning government.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and MUJIB MASHAL
byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar.

lead_paragraph: With President Ashraf Ghani antagonizing many with his imperious decisions, some are reconsidering his predecessor, Hamid Karzai, who has not strayed far from the center of power.

headline.main: Afghans Look Back at Karzai Presidency With Surprising Fondness
headline.print_headline: Nostalgia for Karzai Points to Trouble for His Successor
